intro: Silene vivianii, commonly known as the Vivan's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Silene vivianii is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and conservation efforts.
